projects.name: Neutrogena US Skin360
projects.imageAlt: A collage of screenshots taken from the Skin360 webapp.
projects.description:
Skin360 uses facial scan and survey data to recommend skincare routines and products to users. Over the course of 4 years, I worked across all screens of the app, implementing logic and building custom components through several app redesigns. I also built and consumed REST APIs, created data pipelines, and maintained other microservices.
The core functionality of this web app is implemented in a number of web contexts, with varied designs, app flow, and product interaction functionality. In 2024, our team migrated all app instances to NextJS, refactoring Web Component-based legacy code with scalability and future-proofing front of mind. Sibling instances of Neutrogena US's Skin360 app include:

projects.name: Beyond Barriers
projects.imageAlt: A collage of screenshots taken from the Beyond Barriers site.
projects.description: This site houses findings and resources from Concern Worldwide's Beyond Barriers project, which explored the barriers that limit the role of local actors in humanitarian response. I was one of just two main contributors to this site, and particularly enjoyed building the Library and world map modal functionality.

projects.name: Concern USA
projects.imageAlt: A collage of screenshots taken from the Concern USA site.
projects.description: Concern is an international non-profit organization that seeks to end extreme poverty around the world. As part of a small dev team, I worked primarily on v1 of this large, content-rich site, building custom components and scaffolding many pages. To accommodate Concern's unique need for the flexibility to create pages and post content independently, much work was done to ensure that approximately 80 custom components we crafted were built with many conditional style options, and these were made available to 'drop' into new and existing pages via the CMS that Concern uses to add site updates.

projects.name: MIT AgeLab
projects.imageAlt: A collage of screenshots taken from the MIT AgeLab site.
projects.description: I worked on MIT AgeLab's web-presence refresh, helping to build a modernized, organized, responsive site that is intuitive to visitors and assists them in meaningfully engaging with content. I particularly enjoyed building Netlify Functions for the site's 'contact' and 'subscribe'-related routes, as well as creating various instances of the 'card links' that are found across the site. The design of the site is clean with pops of color, and it was delightful to watch it come to life.

projects.name: Grafton Studio
projects.imageAlt: A collage of screenshots taken from the Grafton Studio site.
projects.description: During my time at Grafton Studio, I contributed to two versions of the company's site. The first iteration focused on lean performance and semantic HTML, utilizing primarily HTML and CSS with minimal JavaScript for a lightweight architecture. For the current live version, launched in early 2024, I was one of two primary contributors, responsible for building a significant portion of the site's components and pages. In addition to development, I also crafted much of the copy for the client case studies, ensuring clear, impactful communication of our project outcomes.

projects.name: myGiide
projects.imageAlt: A collage of screenshots taken from the myGiide webapp.
projects.description: Built to complement a book published by a professor at Northeastern University, this web app helps users to understand their level of cross-cultural competence. My primary contributions to the app were for v1 and included backend work building API routes and interacting with the database, as well as frontend work building the surveys, components, and pages that make up the UI.

projects.name: Carbon Calculator
projects.imageAlt: A collage of screenshots taken from Concern USA's Carbon Calculator webapp.
projects.description: This webapp surveys users to determine their carbon footprint based on lifestyle and daily activities. The majority of my work on this project was creating custom components for use in the survey and across the webapp.
